subtitle: Botany Bay stories from 1770
title: Lines in the sand
subjects: Land settlement -- New South Wales -- Botany Bay -- History -- Exhibitions

Aboriginal Australians -- First contact with Europeans -- New South Wales -- Botany Bay -- History -- Exhibitions
Art, Modern -- New South Wales -- Gymea -- Exhibitions

notes.value:
Exhibition held at the Hazelhurst Regional Gallery & Arts Centre, 29 Mar.-11 May 2008.

Essays by Djon Mundine, Keith Vincent Smith and Ace Bourke.

Artists exhibited: Tony Albert, Jacques Arago, Thomas Balcombe, Sir Jospeh Banks, Gordon Bennett, Mervyn Bishop, W. Blake from a sketch by Governor King, Boat-people.org, Richard Bourke, Daniel Boyd,  William Bradley, Gary Carsley, Thomas Chambers, John Chapman, Brenda L. Croft, E. Dayes after John Hunter, Julie Dowling, Don Featherstone, E. Phillips Fox, Paddy Fordham Wainburragna, Charles Gore, Nathalie Hartog-Gautier, Adam Hill, Dianne Jones, Jonathan Jones, Deborah Kelly, Philip Gidley King, Mavis Longbottom and Lola Ryan, Joseph Lycett, Thomas Medland after Richard Cleveley, Fiona MacDonald, William McLeod, Peter Mazell, Penny McDonald, Peter McKenzie, Tracey Moffatt, Samual Neele, Clinton Nain, R. Pickersgill, Michael Riley, Jospeh Robertson, Charles Rodius, Barthelemy Roger after Nicolas-Martin Petit, Joan Ross, Elaine Russell, Michael Tuffery, H.J. Wedge, Guan Wei, Hardy Wilson.

Exhibition also includes curios and art from the Botany Bay National Park (Kurnell) NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service, Dept. of Environment and Climate Change collection.
